name: Integrate Vanta with Your KnowBe4 Console
title: Integrate Vanta with Your KnowBe4 Console
body:
KnowBe4’s integration with Vanta combines KnowBe4’s training results with the Vanta platform, which automatically updates users’ security checklists. You can use this integration to track your KnowBe4 training results, including specific compliance-related training. Once the integration is complete, your Vanta Onboarding settings will automatically recognize KnowBe4 as your default security awareness training.

Note: Before you set up this integration, you'll need to copy the Reporting API Token from your KSAT Account Settings. For more information, see the API section of our KSAT Account Settings: Account Integrations article.

To integrate your KnowBe4 training information with Vanta, follow the steps below:

    1. Log in to your Vanta admin console.
    2. Navigate to the Connect API Token modal.
    3. Add the Reporting API Token found in your KnowBe4 Account Settings. 

  1. Select which training campaigns you want to track. You can select both active and inactive campaigns.

  1. Connect each training campaign with a Vanta SAT type by selecting the type of training from the drop-down menu and selecting the desired check box.

  1. Click Save.

If you're an admin, you can make changes to the integration settings from your Vanta account. Navigate to the Connections page, then click the ... icon on the KnowBe4 tab. You can also track user training progress from the People page.

images.alt:
This image displays a modal dialog box titled **"Connect API Token"** used for configuring an external service connection.

The modal is divided into two primary configuration sections:

1.  **API token:**
    *   A label titled **"API token"** precedes an empty text input field.
    *   Helper text beneath the field reads: "Find your API token on your **account settings.**" (The text 'account settings' is hyperlinked/stylized).

2.  **Server:**
    *   A label titled **"Server"** precedes a dropdown selection box.
    *   The dropdown currently displays the value **"US"**.
    *   Detailed guidance text reads: "See the **API documentation** for guidance on how to determine on which server your account is located." (The text 'API documentation' is hyperlinked/stylized).

**Action Button:**
*   A primary action button, colored purple, is located at the bottom right of the modal, labeled **"Store token"**.
images.context: g> Token found in your KnowBe4 Account Settings.

images.alt:
The image displays a modal dialogue box titled **"Choose security campaigns"** overlaid on a darkened application background.

The content section is labeled **"Campaign details."** A dropdown selector, currently active and opened, is visible, displaying the selected value **"Annual training."**

The open selector reveals a list panel containing:

1.  A dedicated search input field, indicated by a magnifying glass icon and the placeholder text **"Search."**
2.  A list of selectable security campaign options:
    *   Annual training
    *   Test 2
    *   HIPAA training
    *   Policies

The main application background is partially visible, showing truncated text such as **"Monitoring services"** at the bottom.
images.context: You can select both active and inactive campaigns.

images.alt:
This image displays a modal dialog box, titled **"Choose security campaigns,"** overlaid on a grayed-out application background.

**UI Elements and Content:**

1.  **Title:** "Choose security campaigns."
2.  **Configuration Sections:** Two primary sections are visible, each with associated configuration icons (horizontal ellipsis and navigation chevrons):
    *   **Annual training**
    *   **Campaign details**
3.  **Input Field:** Under "Campaign details," a standard dropdown input field is present, currently selected as **"HIPAA training."**
4.  **Checkboxes (Selection List):**
    *   **General security training** (Unchecked; includes an adjacent information icon).
    *   **HIPAA** (Checked with a purple selection indicator).
5.  **Action Link:** A tertiary action link, **"+ Add another campaign,"** is located below the selection list.
6.  **Footer Buttons (Action Buttons):**
    *   **Back** (Secondary action, white background).
    *   **Save** (Primary action, purple background).
images.context: lecting the type of training from the drop-down menu and selecting the desired check box.

images.alt:
The image displays a user interface section dedicated to connecting third-party security awareness training providers.

1.  **Section Header:** The primary header is **Security awareness training providers**.
2.  **Integration Card:** A white, rounded rectangular card lists a specific provider.
    *   **Icon:** A square container holding an orange circular icon featuring a white, counter-clockwise refresh arrow.
    *   **Provider Name and Status:** The name **KnowBe4** is displayed, immediately followed by a small, dark checkmark icon (status confirmed/integrated).
    *   **Description:** The secondary text reads: **Show that your employees have completed security awareness training**.
    *   **Action Indicator:** A small, square overflow menu button (containing a horizontal ellipsis) is located on the far right of the card.
3.  **Call-to-Action (CTA):** A rounded rectangular button, colored light purple, is positioned below the integration card. It contains a plus sign icon and the text **Add**.
images.context: You can also track user training progress from the People page.
